rows.title: Add Ground Rules to the WhatsApp Group Description

title.eng: Add Ground Rules to the WhatsApp Group Description

text.eng:
Remember to add the ground rules to the WhatsApp Group Description. 

‚Äã‚ÄãTo add the ground rules to the Group Description, copy the following ground rules or use the ones agreed during the onboarding session: 

‚ÄúTo make this a safe space for everyone, here are some ground rules:
 
‚úÖ What is said in the group stays in the group. You need to know that this group is private.
‚úÖ Accept each other. Everyone is different and has different experiences.
‚úÖ Share only what you feel comfortable sharing.
‚úÖ Feel free to ask questions!
‚úÖ Respect privacy of personal pictures and videos that are sent to the chat group. 


Open the WhatsApp group chat. 

Tap the group name. 

Tap the existing description, or tap Add Group Description. 
Paste the ground rules. 

Tap Save.

rows.title: Identifying Group Admin

text.eng:
This week you will also ask the group to choose two group admin to keep the WhatsApp Support Group ongoing. 

The WhatsApp groups are designed to support parent engagement in Naungan Kasih. 

Select the 2 parents who receive the most votes to lead the group.

rows.title: What‚Äôs inside the Facilitator Guide?

text.eng: This is a comprehensive guide to help you deliver the programme to parents with confidence. It includes guidance on how to introduce the programme, specific instructions on how to deliver each session, and tips on how to support parents throughout.

rows.text: This is a comprehensive guide to help you deliver the programme to parents with confidence. It includes guidance on how to introduce the programme, specific instructions on how to deliver each session, and tips on how to support parents throughout.

rows.title: What‚Äôs inside the Companion Guide?

text.eng: This guide is to support you as you support parents! It includes information and guidance to help you learn and grow as a facilitator, and information on core skills that parents learn on Naungan Kasih.

rows.text: This guide is to support you as you support parents! It includes information and guidance to help you learn and grow as a facilitator, and information on core skills that parents learn on Naungan Kasih.

rows.title: What to remember?

text.eng:
It is important to follow the manuals as closely as possible. However, manuals are only a guide to support you after what you have learned in the training workshop. 
Remember, HOW you facilitate matters most. Delivering the content is only about 20% of the programme‚Äôs success. The other 80% depends on HOW you facilitate‚Äìyour attitude, your empathy, and how you connect with and support parents throughout their journey.

rows.text:
It is important to follow the manuals as closely as possible. However, manuals are only a guide to support you after what you have learned in the training workshop. 
Remember, HOW you facilitate matters most. Delivering the content is only about 20% of the programme‚Äôs success. The other 80% depends on HOW you facilitate‚Äìyour attitude, your empathy, and how you connect with and support parents throughout their journey.

rows.title: Skills you need

text.eng: The core skills of a good facilitator are a mirror for parents to learn how to bring about the change we want to see in parents and the community. These include understanding stages of child development, praising and encouraging parents, using active listening skills, being consistent and compassionate, exploring problems, and finding solutions together.

rows.text: The core skills of a good facilitator are a mirror for parents to learn how to bring about the change we want to see in parents and the community. These include understanding stages of child development, praising and encouraging parents, using active listening skills, being consistent and compassionate, exploring problems, and finding solutions together.

rows.title: ‚≠ê Remember

text.eng:
Just as we say to the parents, ‚ÄúIt is what you do at home that makes the difference,‚Äù the same thing applies to you: ‚ÄúIt is how you interact with the parents in your group that makes the difference.‚Äù 

If you take the time to deliver a session before it begins, you will be more confident. If there is anything that you cannot remember or feel unsure of, contact another facilitator to practise with.

rows.title: Create a WhatsApp Group

text.eng:
**Make sure you have done the following before the onboarding session starts:** 

- **Save parents‚Äô names and WhatsApp numbers** (if available) on your phone, so you can confirm details during the in-person session.
- **Create your WhatsApp group** with a temporary name and icon. You can keep the temporary name or update it once the group agrees on a name.
The group name should be in this format: 
‚ÄúNaungan Kasih_[GROUP NAME]‚Äù. 

For example, ‚ÄúNaungan Kasih_HappyFamilies‚Äù

rows.text:
**Make sure you have done the following before the onboarding session starts:** 

- **Save parents‚Äô names and WhatsApp numbers** (if available) on your phone, so you can confirm details during the in-person session.
- **Create your WhatsApp group** with a temporary name and icon. You can keep the temporary name or update it once the group agrees on a name.
The group name should be in this format: 
‚ÄúNaungan Kasih_[GROUP NAME]‚Äù. 

For example, ‚ÄúNaungan Kasih_HappyFamilies‚Äù

rows.title: Conduct Chat Session

text.eng:
**Before conducting chat sessions, make sure you:** 

- Create a WhatsApp Group during the onboarding session. 

- Identify the ground rules for the WhatsApp Group

**Structure for the chat session**: 

- Week 0 (after the onboarding session): Welcome, introductions, and reminder of home practice. 

- Week 2: Check-in: Connecting with parents on their progress with Naungan Kasih, and discussion on child‚Äôs development and growth. 

- Week 4: Check-in: Connecting with parents on their progress with Naungan Kasih, and discussion on supporting child‚Äôs learning in a fun and engaging way. 

- Week 6: Check-in: Connecting with parents on their progress with Naungan Kasih, discussion on parent‚Äôs mental health, and identifying group admin to handover the group after final chat session.  

- Week 8: Final Chat Sessions: Sharing new group admin details, and closing.

**When to send the messages** 

- You and your group will decide a time to chat during the onboarding session.

- Each chat session has a reminder message (Message 1) that you should send a few hours before the chat session. 

- Send the remaining messages during the scheduled chat time.

- Send the remaining messages during the scheduled chat time.

rows.title: Share the Messages in Chat Session

title.eng: Share the Messages in Chat Session

text.eng:
- Look for the chat session for the week on the sessions page

- Find the specific week you want to share and click on it.

- Once you're on the content for that week, locate the "Share" icon. It should look like an arrow pointing upward or a box with an arrow, and it's used to share content. Click on the "Share" icon.

- In the menu that appears, select "WhatsApp" as your sharing option.

- Choose your Naungan Kasih Support Group from the list. 

- Before you hit the "Send" button, make sure to add or change any necessary information like your name. 

- Finally, click the "Send" button to share the content with your Naungan Kasih Support Group.

- Before you hit the "Send" button, make sure to add or change any necessary information like your name. 

- Finally, click the "Send" button to share the content with your Naungan Kasih Support Group.

rows.title: Get Help with WhatsApp Support Group

title.eng: Get Help with WhatsApp Support Group

text.eng:
If you require help while moderating your WhatsApp Support Group, the weekly sessions provide a list of FAQ and potential solutions.

If you need support responding to a challenge shared by the parent during your weekly chat session, see ‚ÄúCommon Challenges‚Äù on the homepage. 

Follow the same instructions as Sharing Chat Messages to share the solutions to the challenges. 

If you encounter a challenge not covered in the chat session, kindly contact your supervisor for further guidance.

rows.title: Help Parents Re-Enter the Group ID on Naungan Kasih

title.eng: Help Parents Re-Enter the Group ID on Naungan Kasih

text.eng:
Ensure the parent has finished onboarding onto Naungan Kasih, then ask the parent to:
- Open Naungan Kasih.
- Go to Settings.
- Click on ‚ÄòProfile‚Äô.
- Under ‚ÄòGroup ID‚Äô, enter the Group ID.
- Click ‚ÄòSave‚Äô.

rows.text:
Ensure the parent has finished onboarding onto Naungan Kasih, then ask the parent to:
- Open Naungan Kasih.
- Go to Settings.
- Click on ‚ÄòProfile‚Äô.
- Under ‚ÄòGroup ID‚Äô, enter the Group ID.
- Click ‚ÄòSave‚Äô.

rows.title: Ensure Parents Appear in Your Parent Group on FaciNK

title.eng: Ensure Parents Appear in Your Parent Group on FaciNK

text.eng: Ensure that both your device and the parent‚Äôs device are connected to the Internet, and try again.

rows.text: Ensure that both your device and the parent‚Äôs device are connected to the Internet, and try again.

rows.title: What to cover in the WhatsApp Call?

title.eng: What to cover in the WhatsApp Call?

text.eng:
Thank the parents for volunteering to lead the WhatsApp group.  

While engaging with other parents in the group, keep the following in mind:
üîµ Greet parents when engaging with them.
üîµ Respect what participants share and be aware of different ages, genders, values and circumstances.
üîµ Encourage parents to share and respond to each other - and praise them for it.
üîµ Remind parents of ground rules when needed.
üîµ Model the behaviour you want to see among the parents.

If the parent needs any prompts for discussion, share the following: 

Let us celebrate our successes! What was something positive you experienced when you tried one of the Naungan Kasih skills with your child?

Trying out new skills can be hard at first. What was something difficult that you experienced when you tried a Naungan Kasih skill with your child at home?
Remind the parent that they are not obligated to respond to messages all times. Participants may send messages at any time during the week. To keep your workload manageable, you can respond to messages once or twice a day, depending on your schedule. 

Ask them if they have any questions. 

Remind the parent that unfortunately, you will no longer be able to participate in the WhatsApp group.

rows.title: Set up your profile

text.eng:
- Go to Settings and click the Profile icon

- Type your name under ‚ÄúYour name‚Äù 

- Tap Save

rows.text:
- Go to Settings and click the Profile icon

- Type your name under ‚ÄúYour name‚Äù 

- Tap Save

rows.title: Add a Parent

text.eng:
During onboarding, you will share a 4-character group ID with your parents. When parents join Naungan Kasih, they are prompted to enter this group ID that you share with them. When done, they should be automatically added to your parent group. 

What to do next?
- For each parent:
  - Click on the pencil icon to access the parent profile.
  - Add the First Name and Last Name. (Note: the ‚ÄúNaungan Kasih ID‚Äù is the name that parents entered onto Naungan Kasih during their onboarding.)
  - Click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù.

For information on how to troubleshoot adding a parent to your parent group using your group ID, see the guide on ‚ÄúHow to Troubleshoot with Parents on Joining with My Group ID‚Äù.

rows.text:
During onboarding, you will share a 4-character group ID with your parents. When parents join Naungan Kasih, they are prompted to enter this group ID that you share with them. When done, they should be automatically added to your parent group. 

What to do next?
- For each parent:
  - Click on the pencil icon to access the parent profile.
  - Add the First Name and Last Name. (Note: the ‚ÄúNaungan Kasih ID‚Äù is the name that parents entered onto Naungan Kasih during their onboarding.)
  - Click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù.

For information on how to troubleshoot adding a parent to your parent group using your group ID, see the guide on ‚ÄúHow to Troubleshoot with Parents on Joining with My Group ID‚Äù.

rows.title: Add a Co-Parent

text.eng:
If two parents from the same family are participating in the programme, together, you must link their accounts. 

- In your parent group, click on the ‚ÄúAdd Co-Parent‚Äù icon next to the parent‚Äôs name. 
- Select the co-parent from available parent user profiles. 

*Both parent profiles will be updated to note the co-parent.*

rows.text:
If two parents from the same family are participating in the programme, together, you must link their accounts. 

- In your parent group, click on the ‚ÄúAdd Co-Parent‚Äù icon next to the parent‚Äôs name. 
- Select the co-parent from available parent user profiles. 

*Both parent profiles will be updated to note the co-parent.*

rows.title: Report Attendance

text.eng:
Select the Reports icon from the bottom navigation bar. 

Select the session you are reporting on.

Complete the report 

‚è∞Specify the time spent on preparation, travel, and actual session delivery. 

‚úÖCheck the activities you completed (onboarding) or number of messages you sent (WhatsApp Group)

üîµSelecting the parents who participated in the session:

For in-person sessions, ‚Äúparticipation‚Äù is defined as parents who attended the session, in part or whole. 
For the WhatsApp group, ‚Äúparticipation‚Äù is defined as parents who have sent at least 1 message (text, voice or video), emoji, sticker or GIF during the chat session. 

If you do not see a parent‚Äôs name, then you need to add that parent to the group (see above).

rows.text:

Select the session you are reporting on.

Complete the report 

‚è∞Specify the time spent on preparation, travel, and actual session delivery. 

‚úÖCheck the activities you completed (onboarding) or number of messages you sent (WhatsApp Group)

üîµSelecting the parents who participated in the session:

For in-person sessions, ‚Äúparticipation‚Äù is defined as parents who attended the session, in part or whole. 
For the WhatsApp group, ‚Äúparticipation‚Äù is defined as parents who have sent at least 1 message (text, voice or video), emoji, sticker or GIF during the chat session. 

If you do not see a parent‚Äôs name, then you need to add that parent to the group (see above).

rows.title: Edit an Attendance Report

text.eng:
Only edit an attendance report if you have made a mistake. 

- Select the Reports icon from the bottom navigation bar. 
- Select the session you want to edit by clicking on the edit icon.
- Make your edits.
- Save your report.

rows.text:

- Select the Reports icon from the bottom navigation bar. 
- Select the session you want to edit by clicking on the edit icon.
- Make your edits.
- Save your report.
